creator: abiodun.adegun-amoo@moofatech.co.uk
text:
When generating the dashboard from an existing 'kpi.jtl' file created during a blazemeter run, the dashboard generation works only if all the requests had failed.

Steps:
1. run a jmx on Taurus (Blazemeter) where all requests fail
2. run 'jmeter -g kpi.jtl -o html/'
3. the report dashboard is generated
4. run a jmx on Taurus (Blazemeter) with at least one successful requests
5. run 'jmeter -g kpi.jtl -o html/'

Expected Results:
Report Dashboard is generated

Actual Results: the following message is displayed:
An error occurred: Error while processing samples:Consumer failed with message :Consumer failed with message :Consumer failed with message :Consumer failed with message :Consumer failed with message :No column <failureMessage> found in sample metadata <timeStamp,elapsed,label,responseCode,responseMessage,threadName,success,bytes,grpThreads,allThreads,Latency,Hostname>, check #jmeter.save.saveservice.* properties to add the missing column

Additional Info:
In both cases the exact same headers are generated.

creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
text:
Can you provide :
- jmeter.log
- csv file
- user.properties and jmeter.properties

Did you try with plain JMeter without Taurus ?

Thanks
